It is characterized by its striking, large, violet-blue petals that bloom during the late spring and early summer. The plant has a compact growth habit with thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Simirestis brianii is considered a conservation concern.
